Answer: Small business customers are classified based on the criteria outlined in para 5.9.3 (i) of the RBI Master Circular on Basel III Capital Regulations dated July 1, 2013. This classification is determined by the total average annual turnover being less than Rs.50 crore and the total aggregate funding from any such Small Business Customer being less than Rs.50 crore. "Aggregated funding" refers to the gross amount of all forms of funding (e.g. deposits or debt securities) extended to the legal entity.
